data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.Title
data.value: What type of organisation are you?

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.QuestionDescription
data.value: Parent companies (sometimes called a holding company) own groups. Subsidiaries are the separate organisations that form a group. You’re a parent company if your business owns any subsidiaries. This includes any subsidiaries registered outside of the UK.

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.QuestionOptionLabel1
data.value: Parent company

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.QuestionOptionLabel2
data.value: Subsidiary

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.QuestionOptionLabel3
data.value: Individual company

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.Title1
data.value: What was your group’s last annual turnover?

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.Title2
data.value: What was your organisation’s last reported turnover?

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.QuestionDescription
data.value: Your answer should include the reported turnover of all relevant subsidiaries in your group that supply (create, import, distribute or sell) packaging.

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.QuestionOptionLabel1
data.value: Under £1 million

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.QuestionOptionLabel2
data.value: £1 million to £2 million

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.QuestionOptionLabel3
data.value: £2 million or more

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.QuestionError
data.value: Select a turnover option.

data.name: SingleQuestion.AnnualTurnover.AdditionalDescription1
data.value: Refer to your most recent annual accounts up until 7 April.

data.name: question_option_yes
data.value: Yes

data.name: question_option_no
data.value: No

data.name: SingleQuestion.OwnBrand.Title
data.value: Do you supply goods to the UK market under your own brand?

data.name: SingleQuestion.OwnBrand.AlternateTitle
data.value: <title>Supplying goods to the UK market under your own brand</title>

data.name: SingleQuestion.OwnBrand.BrandDescriptions
data.value:
A brand is something your business could be visibly identified by, including:

  • a name
  • a trademark
  • any distinctive mark

data.name: SingleQuestion.OwnBrand.AnotherOrganisationTasks
data.value:
You supply goods under your own brand even if you pay or license another company to:

  • produce goods that will be supplied under your brand name
  • pack goods that will be supplied under your brand name
  • supply your branded goods in the UK
  • import branded packaged goods for you

data.name: SingleQuestion.OwnBrand.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you supply goods to the UK market under your own brand.

data.name: SingleQuestion.UnbrandedPackaging.Title
data.value: Do you place goods into packaging?

data.name: SingleQuestion.UnbrandedPackaging.AlternateTitle
data.value: Do you place goods into packaging?

data.name: SingleQuestion.UnbrandedPackaging.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you place goods into packaging.

data.name: SingleQuestion.UnbrandedPackaging.PlacingGoodsDescriptions
data.value:
This could be goods you packaged for your own organisation or for another organisation.

Select no if you only pack goods which another large organisation is responsible for.

Learn more about responsibilities

data.name: SingleQuestion.ImportingProducts.Title
data.value: Do you import packaged goods to supply to the UK market?

data.name: SingleQuestion.ImportingProducts.AlternateTitle
data.value: Do you import packaged goods to supply to the UK market?

data.name: SingleQuestion.ImportingProducts.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you import packaged goods to supply to the UK market.

data.name: SingleQuestion.ImportingProducts.PackagingImportDescriptions
data.value:
This also applies to you if you discard the packaging before supplying the goods.

Select no if you only import branded, filled packaging on behalf of a brand owner classed as a large organisation that is established in the UK.

data.name: SingleQuestion.SellingEmptyPackaging.Title
data.value: Do you supply empty packaging you've imported or manufactured?

data.name: SingleQuestion.SellingEmptyPackaging.AlternateTitle
data.value: Supplying empty packaging to businesses that fall under the higher threshold

data.name: SingleQuestion.SellingEmptyPackaging.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you supply empty packaging you've imported or manufactured.

data.name: SingleQuestion.SellingEmptyPackaging.HigherThresholdDescriptions
data.value:
Select yes if you supply to:

  • large organisations which do not pack or fill the packaging, or are brand owners of the packaging
  • small organisations
  • organisations below the small producer threshold

Read more about classifications and thresholds

data.name: SingleQuestion.HiringLoaning.Title
data.value: Do you hire or loan out reusable packaging to UK organisations?

data.name: SingleQuestion.HiringLoaning.AlternateTitle
data.value: hiring or loaning out reusable packaging to UK organisations

data.name: SingleQuestion.HiringLoaning.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you hire or loan out reusable packaging to UK organisations.

data.name: SingleQuestion.HiringLoaning.PackagingHireLoanDescriptions
data.value: Some organisations hire or loan out reusable packaging, such as wooden pallets, to other organisations for transporting or protecting goods. The packaging is returned after use and loaned out again.

data.name: SingleQuestion.OnlineMarketplace.Title
data.value: Do you own an online marketplace allowing non-UK companies to sell packaged goods in the UK?

data.name: SingleQuestion.OnlineMarketplace.AlternateTitle
data.value: Do you own an online marketplace allowing non-UK companies to sell packaged goods in the UK?

data.name: SingleQuestion.OnlineMarketplace.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you own an online marketplace allowing non-UK companies to sell packaged goods in the UK.

data.name: SingleQuestion.OnlineMarketplace.OnlineMarketplaceDescriptions
data.value:
Under EPR for packaging, an online marketplace is a website or app that allows non-UK organisations to sell their goods in the UK.

If your organisation owns a website that sells goods from UK organisations only, this is not classed as an online marketplace.

data.name: SingleQuestion.SupplyingFilledPackaging.Title
data.value: Do you supply filled packaging to end users?

data.name: SingleQuestion.SupplyingFilledPackaging.AlternateTitle
data.value: Do you supply filled packaging to end users?

data.name: SingleQuestion.SupplyingFilledPackaging.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if you supply filled packaging to end users.

data.name: SingleQuestion.SupplyingFilledPackaging.SupplierConsumerDescriptions
data.value: An end user is the last person to use packaging before discarding it. This could be a consumer or a business.

data.name: SingleQuestion.AmountYouSupply.Header
data.value: You told us that you:

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.QuestionError
data.value: Select an organisation type.

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.Summary
data.value: How EPR for packaging affects parent companies and subsidiaries

data.name: SingleQuestion.TypeOfOrganisation.Detail
data.value:
There are different ways you can comply with EPR for packaging.

You can register as:

  • a whole group (in this instance, the parent group complies with EPR for packaging on behalf of every subsidiary within the group)
  • individual subsidiaries (in this instance, the subsidiaries that meet the turnover and tonnage requirements comply with EPR for packaging independently)
  • a parent company for part of the group (this is where the parent company registers to comply with EPR for packaging on behalf of some, but not all of its subsidiaries)

Check which type of organisation you should select

data.name: SingleQuestion.AmountYouSupply.QuestionTitleSingular
data.value: How much packaging in total did you supply or import in this way, in 2022?

data.name: SingleQuestion.AmountYouSupply.QuestionTitle
data.value: How much packaging in total do you supply?

data.name: SingleQuestion.YouToldUsHeader
data.value: You told us that you:

data.name: SingleQuestion.PlaceDrinksOnMarket.Title
data.value: Do you supply drinks in single-use containers in the UK?

data.name: SingleQuestion.PlaceDrinksOnMarket.ScotlandSummary
data.value: What to do if you place drinks on the market in Scotland

data.name: SingleQuestion.PlaceDrinksOnMarket.ScotlandDetail
data.value:
From October 2025, Scotland will operate a Deposit Return Scheme.

This may affect organisations that place drinks on the market in Scotland.

Find out more about Scotland's Deposit Return Scheme (opens in new tab)

data.name: SingleQuestion.PlaceDrinksOnMarket.Error
data.value: Select yes if you supply drinks in single-use containers in the UK.

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.AluminiumCans
data.value: Aluminium cans

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.None
data.value: None of the above

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.GlassBottles
data.value: Glass bottles

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.SteelCans
data.value: Steel cans

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.PlasticBottles
data.value: Polyethylene terephthalate (PET) plastic bottles

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.Title
data.value: Do you use any of the following materials for the drinks containers?

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.QuestionError
data.value: Select one or more materials options.

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.QuestionTitle
data.value: Do you use any of the following materials for the drinks containers?

data.name: SingleQuestion.MaterialsForDrinksContainers.QuestionDescription
data.value: Select all that apply.

data.name: SingleQuestion.ContainerVolume.Title
data.value: Are any of the containers between 150ml and 3l?

data.name: SingleQuestion.ContainerVolume.QuestionDescription
data.value: This includes containers between 150ml and 3l that are sold in multipacks.

data.name: SingleQuestion.ContainerVolume.QuestionError
data.value: Select yes if any of the containers are between 150ml and 3l.
